Tablet display sizes have increased significantly in recent years. Modern tablet displays can be as big as nearly a laptop. While they have their advantages, they can also prove to be cumbersome. This is where small and compact tablets like Apple iPad Mini come into the picture.

The iPad Mini is the perfect small tablet for Apple users/fans but what about Android counterparts? If you are in the market for a small-sized Android tablet, we are here to help. Check out these best Android-powered iPad alternatives you can get in 2025.

  1. Samsung Galaxy Tab A9
  2. Lenovo Tab M9
  3. Amazon Fire HD 8 (2024)
  4. Amazon Fire 7
  5. TCL Tab 8 LE

Samsung Galaxy Tab A9

The Samsung Galaxy Tab A9 sports an 8.7-inch TFT LCD display with 800 x 1340 pixels resolution. Under the hood, it has the octa-core MediaTek G99 processor with up to 8GB of RAM. The tablet has 64GB/128GB storage options and an 8MP rear camera.

It has a 5,100mAh battery with 15W fast charging support. You can choose whether to get WiFi-only or a cellular variant.

  • Price: $104.89
  • Amazon Review Score: 4.0 (based on 592 ratings)

Lenovo Tab M9

The Lenovo Tab M9 is an Android tablet with a 9-inch IPS LCD display (800 x 1340 pixels). There is the octa-core MediaTek Helio G80 processor paired with up to 4GB of RAM. Its storage options include 32GB, 64GB, and 128GB. The tablet has an 8MP rear camera and a 5,100mAh battery with 10W fast charging.

  • Price: $104.99
  • Amazon Review Score: 4.3 (based on 1,166 ratings)

Amazon Fire HD 8 (2024)

Amazon refreshed its popular budget tablet Fire HD 8 last year. The new model has up to 4GB RAM and 32GB/64GB storage options. It continues to sport an 8-inch HD display. The battery capacity is unknown but is claimed to offer up to 13 hours of battery life. The refreshed model also gets a taste of AI tricks as you will get Writing Assist, Webpage Summaries, and Wallpaper Creator AI features.

  • Price: $99.99
  • Amazon Review Score: 4.4 (based on 1,717 ratings)

Amazon Fire 7

If you want something truly compact, you would have to look at the Amazon Fire 7. It sports a 7-inch display, a quad-core processor, and 2GB of RAM. Its onboard storage options include 16GB and 32GB. It claims to deliver up to 10 hours of battery life on a single charge. It is certainly not a performance-centric tablet but can help you get things done like streaming and reading.

  • Price: $94.99
  • Amazon Review Score: 4.4 (based on 18,631 ratings)

TCL Tab 8 LE

The TCL Tab 8 LE is a budget tablet with an 8-inch IPS LCD display (800 x 1280 pixels). It is available with the MediaTek Helio A22 processor, 3GB RAM, and 32GB onboard storage. The tablet has a 5MP rear camera and a 4,080mAh battery.

  • Price: $74.99
  • Amazon Review Score: NA
